messages: a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:44): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: you around?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (15:51): somewhat
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:54): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: I'm wondering if/when the status of the separate Origin spec is going to be out of limbo
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:55): I think it's clear it is dead at the IETF
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:55): so we can give up on trying to move it forward there
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:56): but do we maybe want to pursue publishing it as a separate spec in WebApps, or not?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (15:59): Origin is still part of CORS
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (15:59): always was
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (16:01): though come to think of it that doesn't define the semantics necessary for CSRF protection
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (16:01): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: bingo
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (16:01): I'm not too interested in taking that up myself though
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (16:01): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: not asking you to personally
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (16:01): I think abarth would be fine with handling that
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (16:01): continuing to, I mean
8d52bf87a239352ba7cc0aba1035e393 (16:02): thinks that the public key approach could even work out in the context of CORS
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (16:02): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: so given that, do you agree that it would make some sense to move it forward as a separate spec, or not?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (16:03): sure
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (16:05): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: OK, I will talk with Art and Chaals and shepazu about it
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (16:05): snaps at Anne (but still loves Anne:) )
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (16:05): god help us all if taking on Origin spec requires a charter change
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (16:06): dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb, I actually read the specs
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (16:06): dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb, I don't think either makes sense
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (16:07): that's more like it :)
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (16:07): dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb, and your confusing emails are not helping
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (16:07): 56ef338f9fcf9452fc833a005325025e told me that using logic on mailing lists was bad form, blame him
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (16:07): :p
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (16:08): hehe. The problem is that I was being sarcastic about requestFeature and you kinda missed that
56ef338f9fcf9452fc833a005325025e (16:08): dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb: they don't have sarcasm or irony in NL
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (16:08): ah, right
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (16:09): at least not the kind that's dumb enough for Australians to understand
